meanings.definition: Make or cause to make a loud, harsh sound.
meanings.sent1: The fire alarm blared loudly in the building.
meanings.sent2: The sirens blared as the police car raced down the street.
meanings.sent3: The horn blared so loudly that it startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The music blared from the speakers, filling the room with energy.
meanings.sent5: The announcement blared over the intercom, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.sent1: The blared of the car horns outside was deafening.
meanings.sent2: The sudden blared of the alarm clock woke me up.
meanings.sent3: The blared of the trumpet added a festive touch to the parade.
meanings.sent4: The blared of the thunder shook the windows in the house.
meanings.sent5: The blared of the fireworks lit up the night sky with color.
